meanings.definition: Feus (noun): plural of feu, a feudal land grant in Scotland
meanings.sent1: The feus were valuable pieces of land in medieval Scotland.
meanings.sent2: The king granted the feus to his loyal knights.
meanings.sent3: The feus were like golden tickets for the lucky recipients.
meanings.sent4: In the game of feudal land grants, the feus were the ultimate prize.
meanings.sent5: The feus symbolized power and wealth in the ancient kingdom.

meanings.definition: Feus (verb): third person singular present of feu, to grant land in feudal tenure
meanings.sent1: He feus the land to the villagers for their use.
meanings.sent2: The landlord feus the estate to the tenants every year.
meanings.sent3: Feusing the property was a way to ensure its proper maintenance.
meanings.sent4: She feus the farmland with great care and consideration.
meanings.sent5: Feusing the land was a tradition passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: Feus (adjective): relating to or characteristic of feus
meanings.sent1: The feus architecture reflected the historical style of the region.
meanings.sent2: The feus tradition was deeply ingrained in the local culture.
meanings.sent3: Her feus dress was a beautiful blend of modern and traditional elements.
meanings.sent4: The feus customs were passed down from generation to generation.
meanings.sent5: The feus festival celebrated the rich heritage of the community.
